qas.question: What has at times led to immense violence against Jehovah's Witnesses?
Why have Jehovah's Witnesses sometimes been imprisoned?

answers.text: doctrine of political neutrality and their refusal to serve in the military

qas.question: Of the 20,000 Jehovah's Witnesses in Germany in 1933, how many were later imprisoned?
What were Jehovah's Witnesses identified by in Nazi concentration camps?
What countries ban the religious activities of Jehovah's Witnesses?

answers.text: China, Vietnam and some Islamic states

qas.question: How many Jehovah's Witnesses were there in Canada at the start of World War II?
How many Jehovah's Witnesses were there in the Soviet Union at the start of World War II?
How many Jehovah's Witnesses died in the Soviet Union during World War II?
How many Jehovah's Witnesses escaped Germany during World War II?
How many Jehovah's Witnesses are there thought to be in China today?

context: <a0_0>Political and religious animosity<a0_0/> against Jehovah's Witnesses has at times led to mob action and government oppression in various countries. Their <a1_0>doctrine of political neutrality and their refusal to serve in the military<a1_0/> has led to imprisonment of members who refused conscription during World War II and at other times where national service has been compulsory. In 1933, there were approximately 20,000 Jehovah's Witnesses in Germany, of whom about <a2_0><b5_0><b8_0>10,000<b8_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/> were later imprisoned. Of those, 2000 were sent to Nazi concentration camps, where they were identified by <a3_0>purple triangles<a3_0/>; as many as <b7_0>1200<b7_0/> died, including <b9_0>250<b9_0/> who were executed. In Canada, Jehovah's Witnesses were interned in camps along with political dissidents and people of Chinese and Japanese descent. In the former Soviet Union, about <b6_0>9,300<b6_0/> Jehovah's Witnesses were deported to Siberia as part of Operation North in April 1951. Their religious activities are currently banned or restricted in some countries, including <a4_0>China, Vietnam and some Islamic states<a4_0/>.
